refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GDBusProxy implements GDBusInterface, GInitable and GAsyncInitable.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GDBusProxy is a base class used for proxies to access a D-Bus interface on a remote object. A GDBusProxy can be constructed for both well-known and unique names.

By default, GDBusProxy will cache all properties (and listen to changes) of the remote object, and proxy all signals that get emitted. This behaviour can be changed by passing suitable GDBusProxyFlags when the proxy is created. If the proxy is for a well-known name, the property cache is flushed when the name owner vanishes and reloaded when a name owner appears.

If a GDBusProxy is used for a well-known name, the owner of the name is tracked and can be read from “g-name-owner”. Connect to the “notify” signal to get notified of changes. Additionally, only signals and property changes emitted from the current name owner are considered and calls are always sent to the current name owner. This avoids a number of race conditions when the name is lost by one owner and claimed by another. However, if no name owner currently exists, then calls will be sent to the well-known name which may result in the message bus launching an owner (unless G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START is set).

The generic “g-properties-changed” and “g-signal” signals are not very convenient to work with. Therefore, the recommended way of working with proxies is to subclass GDBusProxy, and have more natural properties and signals in your derived class. This example shows how this can easily be done using the gdbus-codegen tool.

A GDBusProxy instance can be used from multiple threads but note that all signals (e.g. “g-signal”, “g-properties-changed” and “notify”) are emitted in the thread-default main context of the thread where the instance was constructed.
An example using a proxy for a well-known name can be found in gdbus-example-watch-proxy.c

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a proxy for accessing interface_name on the remote object at object_path owned by name at connection and asynchronously loads D-Bus properties unless the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_LOAD_PROPERTIES flag is used. Connect to the “g-properties-changed” signal to get notified about property changes.
If the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_CONNECT_SIGNALS flag is not set, also sets up match rules for signals. Connect to the “g-signal” signal to handle signals from the remote object.

If name is a well-known name and the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START and G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START_AT_CONSTRUCTION flags aren't set and no name owner currently exists, the message bus will be requested to launch a name owner for the name.
This is a failable asynchronous constructor - when the proxy is ready, callback will be invoked and you can use g_dbus_proxy_new_finish() to get the result.
See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() and for a synchronous version of this constructor.
GDBusProxy is used in this example.

entry.para: Flags used when constructing the proxy.
A GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that proxy conforms to or NULL.
A bus name (well-known or unique) or NULL if connection is not a message bus connection.
Callback function to invoke when the proxy is ready.
User data to pass to callback .

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes creating a GDBusProxy.

entry.para: A GAsyncResult obtained from the GAsyncReadyCallback function passed to g_dbus_proxy_new().
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusProxy or NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new_sync ()
refsect2.para: Creates a proxy for accessing interface_name on the remote object at object_path owned by name at connection and synchronously loads D-Bus properties unless the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_LOAD_PROPERTIES flag is used.
If the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_CONNECT_SIGNALS flag is not set, also sets up match rules for signals. Connect to the “g-signal” signal to handle signals from the remote object.

If name is a well-known name and the G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START and G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START_AT_CONSTRUCTION flags aren't set and no name owner currently exists, the message bus will be requested to launch a name owner for the name.
This is a synchronous failable constructor. See g_dbus_proxy_new() and g_dbus_proxy_new_finish() for the asynchronous version.
GDBusProxy is used in this example.

entry.para: Flags used when constructing the proxy.
A GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that proxy conforms to or NULL.
A bus name (well-known or unique) or NULL if connection is not a message bus connection.
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusProxy or NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus ()
refsect2.para: Like g_dbus_proxy_new() but takes a GBusType instead of a GDBusConnection.
GDBusProxy is used in this example.

entry.para: Flags used when constructing the proxy.
A GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that proxy conforms to or NULL.
Callback function to invoke when the proxy is ready.
User data to pass to callback .

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes creating a GDBusProxy.

entry.para: A GAsyncResult obtained from the GAsyncReadyCallback function passed to g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus().
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusProxy or NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus_sync ()
refsect2.para: Like g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() but takes a GBusType instead of a GDBusConnection.
GDBusProxy is used in this example.

entry.para: Flags used when constructing the proxy.
A GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that proxy conforms to or NULL.
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusProxy or NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_flags ()
refsect2.para: Gets the flags that proxy was constructed with.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_connection ()
refsect2.para: Gets the connection proxy is for.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusConnection owned by proxy . Do not free.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name that proxy was constructed for.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A string owned by proxy . Do not free.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_name_owner ()
refsect2.para: The unique name that owns the name that proxy is for or NULL if no-one currently owns that name. You may connect to the “notify” signal to track changes to the “g-name-owner” property.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The name owner or NULL if no name owner exists. Free with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_object_path ()
refsect2.para: Gets the object path proxy is for.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A string owned by proxy . Do not free.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_interface_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the D-Bus interface name proxy is for.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A string owned by proxy . Do not free.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_default_timeout ()
refsect2.para: Gets the timeout to use if -1 (specifying default timeout) is passed as timeout_msec in the g_dbus_proxy_call() and g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() functions.
See the “g-default-timeout” property for more details.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_set_default_timeout ()
refsect2.para: Sets the timeout to use if -1 (specifying default timeout) is passed as timeout_msec in the g_dbus_proxy_call() and g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() functions.
See the “g-default-timeout” property for more details.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_cached_property ()
refsect2.para: Looks up the value for a property from the cache. This call does no blocking IO.
If proxy has an expected interface (see “g-interface-info”) and property_name is referenced by it, then value is checked against the type of the property.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A reference to the GVariant instance that holds the value for property_name or NULL if the value is not in the cache. The returned reference must be freed with g_variant_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_set_cached_property ()
refsect2.para: If value is not NULL, sets the cached value for the property with name property_name to the value in value .
If value is NULL, then the cached value is removed from the property cache.
If proxy has an expected interface (see “g-interface-info”) and property_name is referenced by it, then value is checked against the type of the property.
If the value GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g.

Normally you will not need to use this method since proxy
is tracking changes using the org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.PropertiesChanged D-Bus signal. However, for performance reasons an object may decide to not use this signal for some properties and instead use a proprietary out-of-band mechanism to transmit changes.

As a concrete example, consider an object with a property ChatroomParticipants which is an array of strings. Instead of transmitting the same (long) array every time the property changes, it is more efficient to only transmit the delta using e.g. signals ChatroomParticipantJoined(String name) and ChatroomParticipantParted(String name).

entry.para: Value for the property or NULL to remove it from the cache.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_cached_property_names ()
refsect2.para: Gets the names of all cached properties on proxy .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A NULL-terminated array of strings or NULL if proxy has no cached properties. Free the returned array with g_strfreev().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_set_interface_info ()
refsect2.para: Ensure that interactions with proxy conform to the given interface. See the “g-interface-info” property for more details.

entry.para: Minimum interface this proxy conforms to or NULL to unset.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_get_interface_info ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GDBusInterfaceInfo, if any, specifying the interface that proxy conforms to. See the “g-interface-info” property for more details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GDBusInterfaceInfo or NULL. Do not unref the returned object, it is owned by proxy .

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_dbus_proxy_call (GDBusProxy *proxy, const gchar *method_name, GVariant *parameters, GDBusCallFlags flags, gint timeout_msec, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Asynchronously invokes the method_name method on proxy .
If method_name contains any dots, then name is split into interface and method name parts. This allows using proxy for invoking methods on other interfaces.

If the GDBusConnection associated with proxy is closed then the operation will fail with G_IO_ERROR_CLOSED. If cancellable is canceled, the operation will fail with G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED. If parameters contains a value not compatible with the D-Bus protocol, the operation fails with G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT.
If the parameters GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g.:

informalexample.programlisting: g_dbus_proxy_call (proxy, "TwoStrings", g_variant_new ("(ss)", "Thing One", "Thing Two"), G_DBUS_CALL_FLAGS_NONE, -1, NULL, (GAsyncReadyCallback) two_strings_done, &data);

refsect2.para: If proxy has an expected interface (see “g-interface-info”) and method_name is referenced by it, then the return value is checked against the return type.

This is an asynchronous method. When the operation is finished, callback will be invoked in the thread-default main context of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call g_dbus_proxy_call_finish() to get the result of the operation. See g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() for the synchronous version of this method.
If callback is NULL then the D-Bus method call message will be sent with the G_DBUS_MESSAGE_FLAGS_NO_REPLY_EXPECTED flag set.

entry.para: A GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or NULL if not passing parameters.
The timeout in milliseconds (with G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.
A GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or NULL if you don't care about the result of the method invocation.
The data to pass to callback .

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_proxy_call().

entry.para: A GAsyncResult obtained from the GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_proxy_call().
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: NULL if error is set. Otherwise a GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: GVariant * g_dbus_proxy_call_sync (GDBusProxy *proxy, const gchar *method_name, GVariant *parameters, GDBusCallFlags flags, gint timeout_msec, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Synchronously invokes the method_name method on proxy .
If method_name contains any dots, then name is split into interface and method name parts. This allows using proxy for invoking methods on other interfaces.

If the GDBusConnection associated with proxy is disconnected then the operation will fail with G_IO_ERROR_CLOSED. If cancellable is canceled, the operation will fail with G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED. If parameters contains a value not compatible with the D-Bus protocol, the operation fails with G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT.
If the parameters GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g.:

informalexample.programlisting: g_dbus_proxy_call_sync (proxy, "TwoStrings", g_variant_new ("(ss)", "Thing One", "Thing Two"), G_DBUS_CALL_FLAGS_NONE, -1, NULL, &error);

refsect2.para: The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received. See g_dbus_proxy_call() for the asynchronous version of this method.
If proxy has an expected interface (see “g-interface-info”) and method_name is referenced by it, then the return value is checked against the return type.

entry.para: A GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or NULL if not passing parameters.
The timeout in milliseconds (with G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: NULL if error is set. Otherwise a GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list (GDBusProxy *proxy, const gchar *method_name, GVariant *parameters, GDBusCallFlags flags, gint timeout_msec, GUnixFDList *fd_list, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Like g_dbus_proxy_call() but also takes a GUnixFDList object.
This method is only available on UNIX.

entry.para: A GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or NULL if not passing parameters.
The timeout in milliseconds (with G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.
A GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or NULL if you don't care about the result of the method invocation.
The data to pass to callback .

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list().

entry.para: Return location for a GUnixFDList or NULL.
A GAsyncResult obtained from the GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list().
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: NULL if error is set. Otherwise a GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: GVariant * g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list_sync (GDBusProxy *proxy, const gchar *method_name, GVariant *parameters, GDBusCallFlags flags, gint timeout_msec, GUnixFDList *fd_list, GUnixFDList **out_fd_list, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Like g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() but also takes and returns GUnixFDList objects.
This method is only available on UNIX.

entry.para: A GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or NULL if not passing parameters.
The timeout in milliseconds (with G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.
Return location for a GUnixFDList or NULL.
Return location for error or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: NULL if error is set. Otherwise a GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: enum GDBusProxyFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when constructing an instance of a GDBusProxy derived class.

entry.para: Don't connect to signals on the remote object.
If the proxy is for a well-known name, do not ask the bus to launch an owner during proxy initialization or a method call. This flag is only meaningful in proxies for well-known names.

If set, the property value for any __invalidated property__ will be (asynchronously) retrieved upon receiving the PropertiesChanged D-Bus signal and the property will not cause emission of the “g-properties-changed” signal. When the value is received the “g-properties-changed” signal is emitted for the property along with the retrieved value. Since 2.32.

If the proxy is for a well-known name, do not ask the bus to launch an owner during proxy initialization, but allow it to be autostarted by a method call. This flag is only meaningful in proxies for well-known names, and only if G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START is not also specified.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: GDBusProxy
refsect2.para: The GDBusProxy structure contains only private data and should only be accessed using the provided API.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: struct GDBusProxyClass
refsect2.para: Class structure for GDBusProxy.

entry.para: Signal class handler for the “g-properties-changed” signal.
Signal class handler for the “g-signal” signal.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-bus-type” property
refsect2.para: If this property is not G_BUS_TYPE_NONE, then “g-connection” must be NULL and will be set to the GDBusConnection obtained by calling g_bus_get() with the value of this property.
Flags: Write / Construct Only
Default value: G_BUS_TYPE_NONE
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-connection” property
refsect2.para: The GDBusConnection the proxy is for.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-default-timeout” property
refsect2.para: The timeout to use if -1 (specifying default timeout) is passed as timeout_msec in the g_dbus_proxy_call() and g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() functions.

This allows applications to set a proxy-wide timeout for all remote method invocations on the proxy. If this property is -1, the default timeout (typically 25 seconds) is used. If set to G_MAXINT, then no timeout is used.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: -1
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-flags” property
refsect2.para: Flags from the GDBusProxyFlags enumeration.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-interface-info” property
refsect2.para: Ensure that interactions with this proxy conform to the given interface. This is mainly to ensure that malformed data received from the other peer is ignored. The given GDBusInterfaceInfo is said to be the "expected interface".
The checks performed are:

listitem.para: When completing a method call, if the type signature of the reply message isn't what's expected, the reply is discarded and the GError is set to G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT.
Received signals that have a type signature mismatch are dropped and a warning is logged via g_warning().

Properties received via the initial GetAll() call or via the
::PropertiesChanged signal (on the org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties interface) or set using g_dbus_proxy_set_cached_property() with a type signature mismatch are ignored and a warning is logged via g_warning().

refsect2.para: Note that these checks are never done on methods, signals and properties that are not referenced in the given GDBusInterfaceInfo, since extending a D-Bus interface on the service-side is not considered an ABI break.
Flags: Read / Write
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-interface-name” property
refsect2.para: The D-Bus interface name the proxy is for.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-name” property
refsect2.para: The well-known or unique name that the proxy is for.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-name-owner” property
refsect2.para: The unique name that owns “g-name” or NULL if no-one currently owns that name. You may connect to “notify” signal to track changes to this property.
Flags: Read
Default value: NULL
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-object-path” property
refsect2.para: The object path the proxy is for.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-properties-changed” signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GDBusProxy *proxy, GVariant *changed_properties, GStrv invalidated_properties, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Emitted when one or more D-Bus properties on proxy changes. The local cache has already been updated when this signal fires. Note that both changed_properties and invalidated_properties are guaranteed to never be NULL (either may be empty though).
If the proxy has the flag G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_GET_INVALIDATED_PROPERTIES set, then invalidated_properties will always be empty.
This signal corresponds to the PropertiesChanged D-Bus signal on the org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties interface.

entry.para: A GVariant containing the properties that changed (type: a{sv})
A NULL terminated array of properties that was invalidated

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: The “g-signal” signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GDBusProxy *proxy, gchar *sender_name, gchar *signal_name, GVariant *parameters, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Emitted when a signal from the remote object and interface that proxy is for, has been received.

entry.para: The sender of the signal or NULL if the connection is not a bus connection.
A GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
Since: 2.26
